IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE- V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES)
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
Present:-Smt. Aswathy. S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Thursday the 30" day of January, 2025./ 10th Magha, 1946.
CC. 2647/2018
Complainant : State-represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Mannanthala
Police Station in Crime No. 1398/2018.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : Al. Binu, aged 34 years, S/o. Thulasi, Santha Bhavan,
Theracode, Kallayam Ward, Karakulam Village. (Split up).
A2. Ajayan, aged 36 years, S/o. Babu, Santha Bhavan,
Theracode, Kallayam Ward, Karakulam Village.
( By Advocate Sri. Biju.H)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 323 read with
section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence/Order : Accused No. 2 is found not guilty of offences punishable under
sections 294(b) and 323 read with section 34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860 and he is acquitted of the said offences under section
255(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. Case against accused
No.1 is split up and refiled as CC. 108/2025.
Description of accused
A2. Ajayan Karakulam Village | Thiruvananthapuram
DATE OF
Occurrence | Report of | Apprehension | Period of detention | Released | Commencem
Complaint | of accused undergone during on bail ent of trial
investigation inquiry
or trial for the
purpose of S. 428
Cr.P.C
17.10.2018 | 30.10.2018} 18.12.2019 18.12.2019 18.12.2019} 22.03.2022

2 Of 6
evidence dela
This case having been finally heard today, the court delivered the following:
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 323
read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. Prosecution case_in_ brief_is as follows:- Due to the prior enmity, on
17.10.2018, at 18.30 hours, the accused no.1 by uttering obscene words, fisted
on the cheek of CW1 at the Kallayam Junction, Plavuvila Ward, Vattappara
Village, and by kicking on his abdomen, pushed him towards the public road,
the accused no.2 caught his head and hit it against the road resulting injuries.
It is alleged that accused nos. 1 and 2 beaten all over the body of CW1. Thus
the accused has committed offences punishable u/ss. 294(b) and 323 read with
section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed before this court by the Sub Inspector of police
Mannanthala police station and the case was taken on file as CC. 2647/2018.
Cognizance was taken for the offences punishable u/s 294(b) and 323 read with
section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 against the accused Nos. 1 and 2.

4. On appearance of accused No.2 he was enlarged on bail on 18.12.2019. On

3 OF 6

his appearance relevant records of prosecution were served u/s. 207 Code of

Criminal Procedure, 1973. Particulars of offences punishable under sections

294(b) and 323 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 read over and

explained to the accused No.2. He pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Exhibit P1 was marked.

As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned

Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW8. In the absence of any

incriminating circumstances against the accused No. questioning of the

accused No., under section 313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 was
dispensed with. Accused No.2. was called upon to adduce evidence but no
defence evidence was adduced from the side of the accused No.2

6. Heard both sides.

7. Points that arose for consideration are as follows:-

1. Whether on 17.10.2018, 18.30 hours, near Kallayam Junction, Plavuvila
Ward, Vattappara Village, infurtherance of their common intention of
accused nos. 1 and 2 , accused No.1 among them uttered obscene words
towards PW1 at Kallayam — Plavuvila public road, which is a public place
and thereby accused have committed offence punishable under section
294(b) read with Sec. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

40f6

2. Whether on the same date at same time and place _ infurtherance of
common intention of accused nos. 1 and 2 , accused No.1 among them
fisted PW1 on his right cheek and pushed him towards the road by kicking
on his abdomen and accused No.2 hold PW1’s head and hit it against road
and thereby committed offence punishable under section 323 of Indian
Penal Code 1860?

3. If the accused No.2. is found guilty? What is the order as to sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 and 2 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point Nos. 1 and 2 are
considered together. Prosecution case is that accused has committed offences
punishable under sections 294(b) and 323 read with section 34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860.

9. PW1 Vinod admitted his signature in Ext. P1 statement. He deposed that
accused persons have not assaulted him and he has no grievance against the
accused persons. Further he deposed that the incident was not witnessed by
any other person.

10. Learned Assistant Public Prosecutor has given up the other witnesses in this
case and she is justified in doing so as the material witness failed to support the
prosecution case. There is nothing on record to disclose that the accused has
committed the offences as alleged by the prosecution. Having considered the

5 OF 6
evidence on record, this court is of the view that the prosecution has failed to
prove the guilt of the accused and for the said reasons, these points are found
against the prosecution.

11. Point No. 3:- Upon the finding in point Nos. 1 and 2, the Accused No. 2 is
found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 323 read
with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and he is acquitted of the said
offences under section 255(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. Case against
accused No.1 is split up and refiled as CC. 108/2025.

No material objects produced in this case.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 30" day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
